meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: House Passes War Bill Requiring Iraq Pullout The House approved a $124 billion war spending bill that would require American troops to begin withdrawing from Iraq by Oct. 1. The Senate is expected to follow suit, setting the stage for the first veto fight between President Bush and the Democratic majority in Congress.
PAGE A12
A Warning From Giuliani Democrats struck back at Rudolph W. Giuliani after he said the United States would suffer more losses from terrorists if a Democrat were elected president.
PAGE A23
McCain Makes It Official Senator John McCain formally began his campaign for the Republican presidential nomination with a thinly veiled critique of Bush administration policies.
PAGE A23

Baseball Looks to Cuba Major League Baseball officials are looking into ways to re-establish a working relationship with Cuba and set up an orderly system for acquiring players from the island nation if and when the United States lifts its trade embargo.
SPORTSTHURSDAY, PAGE D1
Balanchine to the Core The New York City Ballet, with Wendy Whelan and Albert Evans in ''Agon,'' above, begins the season with an all-Balanchine week. A review by Alastair Macaulay.
PAGE E1
Dow Closes Above 13,000 The Dow Jones industrial average closed above 13,000 for the first time and is up 6 percent for April, its best performance in a single month since December 2003.
PAGE C1
A Change at 'The View' Rosie O'Donnell, who raised the ratings of ''The View,'' said she would leave the show in June after contract talks failed.
THE ARTS, PAGE E1

The Senate is expected to follow suit, setting the stage for the first veto fight between President Bush and the Democratic majority in Congress.
